intro: Plagiogyria integripinnata, commonly known as the smooth-leafed liverwort, is a type of non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth and is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rock crevices. The plant has a thalloid structure with a distinct central axis and leaf-like structures called phyllodes. Its leaves are usually smooth and arranged in a single row along the stem, giving it a unique appearance. Plagiogyria integripinnata plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for small invertebrates in its native ecosystems.
